-- Delete database if it exists

IF EXISTS (SELECT name from sys.databases WHERE name = 'MyProjectsDB')
DROP DATABASE MyProjectsDB;

-- Create database
CREATE DATABASE MyProjectsDB;

/*
    A master key in SQL is used to encrypt sensitive data, such as credentials, to ensure secure access. 
    It is required for operations like creating database-scoped credentials. 
    By creating a master key, you enable encryption for securely storing and accessing credentials 
    or other sensitive information within the database.
*/

-- Create the master key for encryption
CREATE MASTER KEY ENCRYPTION BY PASSWORD = 'MyS3cureP@ssw0rd!';

/*
    A SAS token grants time-limited access to specific Azure storage resources 
    without exposing the account key,
    allowing external apps or users to access resources with defined permissions.
*/

-- Create a database-scoped credential for accessing datalake
CREATE DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL myStorageCred
WITH IDENTITY = 'SHARED ACCESS SIGNATURE',
SECRET = '&sr=c&sig=eb9Qee0ACuFPNGl6r0lcpPPyxc87u9sZHp%2FaZBBU6kw%3D';


CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE ExternalDataLakeStoreProj
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'https://projectsstore1.blob.core.windows.net/synapse-proj-files/'
    CREDENTIAL = myStorageCred
);
